channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 在 20 世纪 90 年代的经济动荡中，中国工业中心地带的数百万劳动者失去了工作。犯罪率和贫困率上升。双雪涛是中国最著名的青年作家之一，他的散文中充满了这种集体苦难的遗产。
item.description:
In the economic upheaval of the 1990s, millions of laborers in China’s industrial heartland lost their jobs. Crime and poverty rose. The legacy of that communal suffering animates the prose of Xuetao Shuang, one of China’s most celebrated young authors. https://t.co/Fai74xSvLD

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 加拿大第 18 任总理布莱恩-马尔罗尼（Brian Mulroney）去世，享年 84 岁。
item.description:
Brian Mulroney, Canada’s 18th prime minister, has died at 84. https://t.co/nHaoNJIMaJ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 挪威国王哈拉尔五世在马来西亚接受了一个临时心脏起搏器，以帮助他回家。他在一次旅行中因感染住院。
item.description:
King Harald V of Norway received a temporary pacemaker while in Malaysia to help him return home. He had been been hospitalized with an infection while on a trip. https://t.co/2nFdwzNHoz

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 都柏林波希米亚人足球俱乐部将支持社会事业作为其身份的重要组成部分。批评者认为，波希米亚人已被时髦人士所取代，但他们的做法却吸引了世界各地的球迷。
item.description:
The Dublin soccer club Bohemians has made support for social causes a crucial part of its identity. Critics say the hipsters have taken over, but the approach has attracted fans around the world. https://t.co/9JRAHkP0ZR

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 伊朗于周五举行了议会选举，尽管官员们在最后一刻试图通过社交媒体上的呼吁和投票站的玫瑰花来提高投票率，但许多人还是没有参加投票，以示对政府的抗议。
item.description:
Iran held parliamentary elections on Friday, but despite officials’ last-minute attempts to increase turnout with pleas on social media and roses at polling stations, many people stayed away from the ballot in an act of protest against the government. https://t.co/J5XaoonZx3

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 在脱离西班牙独立两个世纪后，许多哥伦比亚人仍将 "su merced"（意为 "您的仁慈"）作为日常称呼。
item.description:
Two centuries after independence from Spain, many Colombians still use “su merced,” meaning “your mercy” as an everyday address. https://t.co/b7F4z3rtfg

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 在巴基斯坦，被判亵渎罪可能意味着死刑。但暴民有时会自作主张，在案件开庭审理之前就将人处以私刑。
item.description:
A blasphemy conviction in Pakistan could mean death. But mobs sometimes take matters into their own hands, lynching people before their cases can even go to trial. https://t.co/MDx8yWnSlP

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 本周世界足球通讯：英超联赛的 "腐败 "呼声；卢顿镇的时光倒流；温布利球场的紧张提醒。
item.description:
In this week’s world soccer newsletter: cries of ‘corrupt’ in the Premier League; a journey back in time at Luton Town; and a nervous reminder at Wembley. https://t.co/A6bXKfmjN0

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 他的女儿问他是否见过 BTS。但这位来自孟加拉国的外来务工人员在韩国的一家纺织厂工作，每周六天，从晚上 7 点工作到早上 7 点，而这家工厂尚未支付他承诺的工资。
item.description:
His daughter asks him whether he had met BTS yet. But the migrant worker from Bangladesh works from 7 p.m. to 7 a.m., six days a week, in a textile factory in South Korea that has yet to pay him the wages it promised https://t.co/0uLFG3ULAx

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 一位悼念者说，"这是我记忆中最乐观的葬礼，"他说，"人山人海，团结感油然而生。"没有悲伤。我们都在一起，我们有很多人。
item.description:
“This was the most optimistic funeral I can remember,” said a mourner, citing the large crowds and a palpable sense of unity. “There was no grief. There was this surge of inspiration that we are all together, and that there are many of us.” https://t.co/KL7MvgoupH

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: "一位巴勒斯坦人说："我看到了从未想过自己会看到的东西。
item.description:
“I saw things I never, ever thought I would see,” said one Palestinian who had camped out overnight for a chance to get food for his family https://t.co/34vUk1D3Jw

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 针对少数球队的几次判罚并不能让英超联赛变得腐败。但这并不意味着球迷的不满没有道理。通过 @RorySmith：
item.description:
A few decisions against a handful of teams do not make the Premier League corrupt. But that doesn’t mean the fans’ grievances aren’t valid. Via @RorySmith: https://t.co/xc5Ev45zwN

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 在 20 世纪 60 年代，被称为维也纳行动主义的激进艺术运动的创始人金特-布鲁斯（Günter Brus）以自己的身体和身体排泄物为媒介，震撼了这个被纳粹历史所困扰的国家，从而引起了众怒并遭到逮捕。
item.description:
Günter Brus, a founder of the radical art movement known as Viennese Actionism who courted outrage and arrest in the 1960s by using his body — and bodily effluvia — as a medium to shock a country haunted by its Nazi past, has died at 85. https://t.co/SkwdgAg7MY

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 贝蒂-菲切特是领导瑞士钟表品牌宝珀的第一位女性，她以创新思维带领宝珀度过了动荡时期。她还发现了女式手表的市场，并设计出玛丽莲-梦露佩戴过的手表。
item.description:
Betty Fiechter was the first woman to lead a Swiss watch brand, Blancpain, which she shepherded through turmoil with her innovative thinking. She also recognized a market for women’s watches and created a watch worn by Marilyn Monroe. https://t.co/bzF8lYtzGD

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 罗伯特-M-杨是一位纪录片导演，其作品题材包括土著居民、鲨鱼和西西里岛的一个贫困家庭。 在转入叙事长片领域后，他执导了《阿兰布里斯塔！》、《极端》和《多米尼克和尤金》等影片。
item.description:
Robert M. Young was a documentarian whose subjects include Indigenous peoples, sharks and a poverty-stricken family in Sicily. After moving into narrative features, he directed films including “Alambrista!,” “Extremities” and “Dominick and Eugene.” https://t.co/ZhTwNoY5OD

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 2, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：美国总统拜登表示，美国将向加沙空投援助物资，并将巴勒斯坦人在车队附近被杀与对物资的绝望联系在一起。
item.description:
Breaking News: The U.S. will airdrop aid to Gaza, said President Biden, who linked the killing of Palestinians near a convoy to desperation for supplies. https://t.co/vQYE461Soc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 加沙当局称，周四清晨在加沙城，一群人聚集在援助卡车周围，以色列军队开火，造成 100 多人死亡，数百人受伤。以下是需要了解的情况。
item.description:
Gazan authorities said that more than 100 people were killed and hundreds more injured early Thursday morning in Gaza City, where a crowd gathered around aid trucks and the Israeli military opened fire. Here's what to know. https://t.co/Qx3iecar6h

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 成千上万的人来到莫斯科参加阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的葬礼。一些人冒着被捕的危险高喊 "反对战争"。纳瓦尔尼先生的灵柩在西纳特拉的歌曲 "我的路 "和电影 "终结者 2 "的旋律中被送入墓地。
item.description:
Thousands turned out for the funeral for Aleksei Navalny in Moscow. Some shouted, “No to war,” risking arrest. Mr. Navalny’s coffin was lowered into the cemetery grounds to the strains of the Sinatra song “My Way” and one from the movie “Terminator 2.” https://t.co/qQONVkHj4v

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 2019 年一座火山岛喷发后，受害者及其家属共获得了约 1020 万新西兰元的赔偿，约合 620 万美元。
item.description:
After a volcanic island erupted in 2019, victims and their families have been awarded a total of about 10.2 million New Zealand dollars, or roughly $6.2 million. https://t.co/4DJZKsLY6A

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 印度最富有的人之一的儿子举行了为期三天的婚前仪式，提高了奢华庆典的标准。
item.description:
A three-day pre-wedding ceremony for the son of one of India’s richest men raises the bar for extravagant festivity. https://t.co/GqZyFSGuWb

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 更多的美国武器将很快在美国之外制造。由于战争使美国的武器库捉襟见肘，华盛顿正寻求与澳大利亚等合作伙伴一起扩大生产。
item.description:
More American weapons will soon be made outside America. With the wars straining U.S. arsenals, Washington is seeking to expand production with partners like Australia. https://t.co/gWB3BwOkj1

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 克劳迪娅-谢恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）是一名物理学家，也是现任总统的门生，她以约 30 个百分点的绝对优势领先于反对党的 Xóchitl Gálvez（一名科技企业家），竞选活动将于周五正式开始。
item.description:
Claudia Sheinbaum, a physicist and protégée of the current president, holds a commanding lead of about 30 percentage points over the opposition’s Xóchitl Gálvez, a tech entrepreneur, as campaigning officially starts on Friday https://t.co/dZU0xM5r3r

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 肯尼亚政府与海地签署了一项协议，将在这个黑帮横行的加勒比国家部署一支多国部队，推进一项备受争议的计划。
item.description:
Kenya’s government signed an agreement with Haiti to deploy a multinational force in the gang-ravaged Caribbean nation, pushing ahead with a controversial plan that has been criticized by rights groups and blocked by a court in the East African nation. https://t.co/wdaseyBU5z

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 在 20 世纪 90 年代的经济动荡中，中国工业中心地带的数百万劳动者失去了工作。犯罪率和贫困率上升。双雪涛是中国最著名的青年作家之一，他的散文中充满了这种集体苦难的遗产。
item.description:
In the economic upheaval of the 1990s, millions of laborers in China’s industrial heartland lost their jobs. Crime and poverty rose. The legacy of that communal suffering animates the prose of Xuetao Shuang, one of China’s most celebrated young authors. https://t.co/4EynOoifBg

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 左派激进分子乔治-加洛韦（George Galloway）赢得了英格兰北部罗奇代尔（Rochdale）议会席位的选举，在此之前，他进行了一场混乱的竞选活动，显示出英国政界对加沙战争的愤怒情绪。
item.description:
George Galloway, a leftist firebrand, won an election for the parliamentary seat in Rochdale, northern England, after a chaotic campaign that showed the anger sweeping through British politics over the war in Gaza. https://t.co/xPnhIF5SO6

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯最著名的反对派人物阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼在北极偏远的刑罚殖民地神秘死亡两周后，莫斯科为他举行的葬礼排起了长队。
item.description:
Long lines of people were forming in Moscow for the funeral services for Aleksei Navalny, Russia’s most prominent opposition figure, two weeks after his mysterious death in a remote Arctic penal colony. https://t.co/wI5gURCWOw

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 他在所谓 "伟大事业 "上的政治家风范，从北美的自由贸易和酸雨，到推翻南非的种族隔离制度，在他卸任后都被指责为财务失当和影响力操纵。
item.description:
His statesmanship on what he called “great causes,” from free trade and acid rain in North America to the overthrow of apartheid in South Africa, gave way to accusations of financial misdoing and influence-peddling after he left office. https://t.co/XqaMprasPC

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 加拿大第 18 任总理布莱恩-马尔罗尼（Brian Mulroney）去世，享年 84 岁。
item.description:
Brian Mulroney, Canada’s 18th prime minister, has died at 84. https://t.co/Md0nD0R7rQ

item.title: 加拿大将开始要求墨西哥公民入境时必须持有签证，此举是为了应对墨西哥国民入境避难申请的增加。
item.description:
Canadá empezará a exigir visa a los ciudadanos mexicanos para entrar al país, una medida que sucede cuando se registra un aumento en las solicitudes de asilo de mexicanos que llegan al país. https://t.co/P9RdPr5Hno

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 1, 2024

item.title: 每一次核剑拔弩张都是为了达到同样的基本目的：弗拉基米尔-普京知道，他的对手最担心乌克兰冲突升级
item.description:
Each instance of nuclear saber‌ rattling has served the same basic purpose: Vladimir Putin knows that his opponents fear escalation of the conflict in Ukraine most of all‌ https://t.co/93HjUQgv0Q

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 29, 2024
